revised_title: Internal Stresses and Glide Mechanism in Plastic Deformation of Silver Chloride
tldr: The authors conducted experiments on the plastic deformation of silver chloride, a transparent and ductile material. They used the photoelastic effect to study the internal stresses and discovered that silver chloride deforms by 'pencil glide', a mechanism previously postulated for the plastic behavior of iron. The findings provide insights into the deformation process of crystalline materials and the role of dislocations in plasticity.
